intro: Dianthus binaludensis, commonly known as the Binalud carnation, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping it retain moisture in its native habitat. Dianthus binaludensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with similar environmental conditions.
